criteria.name: 1.1. Ensure periodic security updates are configured
criteria.description: Description: It is important that servers receive periodic security updates to protect against known vulnerabilities

criteria.name: 2.1. Ensure /tmp is configured
criteria.description: Description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary file storage

criteria.name: 3.1. Ensure bootloader password is set
criteria.description: Description: Setting the boot loader password will require the user to enter the password before modifying the boot configuration

criteria.name: 4.1. Ensure core dumps are restricted
criteria.description: Description: A core dump is the memory of an executable program when it crashes

criteria.name: 5.1. Ensure IP forwarding is disabled
criteria.description: Description: IP forwarding allows packets that aren't destined for the local host to pass through the system

criteria.name: 6.1. Ensure wireless interfaces are disabled
criteria.description: Description: Wireless devices and services can be a security risk on servers

criteria.name: 7.1. Ensure audit is enabled
criteria.description: Description: The auditd daemon should be installed and running to track security-relevant events

criteria.name: 8.1. Ensure password expiration is 90 days or less
9.1. Ensure SSH warning banner is configured
criteria.description: Description: Warnings should be displayed to users at login to ensure legal protection

criteria.name: 10.1. Ensure permissions on /etc/passwd are configured
criteria.description: Description: The /etc/passwd file contains user account information

criteria.name: 11.1. Ensure root PATH integrity
criteria.description: Description: The root PATH should not include writable directories
